Posts.EditableText: Just saying, you can clone an object and create at least two objects with the same name. I'm working around it now - but it would be an idea to double check for this and produce suitable error's! Oh, and a creation of the "destroy <#object#>" and/or "destroy <#room#>" would be nice and very handy for me
Posts.HTML:
Just saying, you can clone an object and create at least two objects with the same name.
I'm working around it now - but it would be an idea to double check for this and produce suitable error's!

Oh, and a creation of the "destroy <#object#>" and/or "destroy <#room#>" would be nice and very handy for me

Posts.EditableText: I'll definitely second that, a 'destroy object <#objectname#>' as well as a 'destroy room <#roomname#>' would make sense, be used quite often, and probably lower memory usage as it takes one less thing to calculate out of the equation.
Posts.HTML: I'll definitely second that, a 'destroy object <#objectname#>' as well as a 'destroy room <#roomname#>' would make sense, be used quite often, and probably lower memory usage as it takes one less thing to calculate out of the equation.

Posts.EditableText: ill third that, that would be extremelly useful
Posts.HTML: ill third that, that would be extremelly useful

Posts.EditableText:
I fourth that.  The less memory taken up, the better.  I only have 64 MB of RAM!
